column4: Someone who have experience of booting via GRUB? I 've tried a cpuple of times the past hour and finds unetbootin but when I choose to "install lubuntu" it startes ubuntu instead.
a live disc will boot and then let you install
I'm not familiar with network installs, but that sounds like your only option
you said your BIOS doesn't support booting from USB..?
I'm confused
but you can't install it after it starts?
oh, ok, so it freezes on startup?
did you check the MD5 on the (l)ubuntu file, or try redownloading it and putting it on your flash drive again?
might still be worth reinstalling on the flash drive, and/or using a different USB port if possible, also check your BIOS
I'll try that
you did check the system requirements, right?  I ask since you said your BIOS doesn't support flash-boot = older
160 and less was not recommended.
160 what?  RAM, MHz?  That's a pretty low number for anything
you might try xubuntu, which is good, just less flashy
yes
try DSL, xubuntu, knoppix, or headless and then install xfce desktop
as bazhang said, lubuntu is another option, but yes, try xubuntu with xfce or something more compact like DSL
or, you could try an older version of ubuntu-- 7, 8, 9
I'm not sure, but that is a potential problem...  you may have to try several different distros/versions to see what your computer can handle
and xubuntu isn't smooth?  as in, visual anomalies or really slow?
D*** Small Linux is about as small as distros get...  maybe try it
